title: Quiz 2 - Statement - Cause And Effect
instruction: Directions: Given below are pairs of events ‘A’ and ‘B’. You have to read both the events ‘A’ and ‘B’ and decide the nature of the relationship. You have to assume that the information given in ‘A’ and ‘B’ is true and you will not assume anything beyond the given information in deciding the answer.

quiz.text: Statements: I: Economic crisis is hindering development in Sri Lanka. II: There is a drop in foreign investment in Sri Lanka.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: Many people living in the low-lying areas have been evacuated during the last few days to safer places. II: The Government has rushed in relief supplies to the people living in the affected areas.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. The state government has now decided to increase the stamp duty on house purchase with immediate effect. II. The real estate prices have increased considerably during the last few months.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. Two strikers of the Argentina football team missed all three group league matches in the world cup due to hamstring injuries. II. Argentina football team lost two matches and won one match in the group league.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. The committee appointed by the Government on the fee structure of the Ph.D. courses has drastically reduced the fees of various courses in comparison to those charged in the last year. II. The students seeking admission to Ph.D. courses had launched a severe agitation protesting the high fees charged by the Ph.D. institutes and the admission process was delayed considerably.
options: Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. Cash is not acceptable at many places after demonetization. II. Many online wallets are tying up with banks so that it is possible for people to go cashless.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: More than 2.5 billion pounds of chemicals are spewed in the air every day by industries and vehicles of some countries. II: International pollution control organization is expected to penalize the countries which cross the maximum emission limits.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: Rural and semi-urban areas in the country have been suffering due to load-shedding for quite some time. II: If the Government is not able to overcome the power crisis, load-shedding will be extended even to the urban areas.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. The performance of most of the students in the final exam of class XII in the Government schools was excellent. II. Many teachers at the Government schools left the school and joined the private school.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: Bank of Haryana, ane private sector Bank has launched a mobile app in India. II: The entry of foreign banks into the Indian market witnessed a rise this year as compared to previous year and they have attracted Indian customers.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: Recently, an Air Asia was grounded in Delhi because of a technical snag. III: Air Asia faces a severe shortage of maintenance engineers.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. The government has increased numbers of buses between Delhi and UP. II. The government has allowed private bus owners to operate between Delhi and UP.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: Many schools in rural areas are run by a single teacher. II: There have been huge dropouts from the schools in rural areas.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: Daily use items will get costly due to recent hikes in GST rates. II: Crude oil prices are increasing.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. The small things that seemed to not matter, started making a positive difference. II. As they say, only an expert can find the nuances, she could find the void in him and knew how to heal them.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. The flood destroyed many homes. II. The rainwater provided refuge from the drought condition.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: The importance of Yoga, Ayurveda, and exercise is being realized by all sections of society. II: There is an increasing awareness about health in society, particularly among middle-aged groups of people.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: The single-child family seems to be fast becoming the norm in the present-day urban setup. II:  People think that parenting is easier when they have only one child.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I: The government of India has instructed the mobile phone service providers to remove roaming charges and charge all calls across different states at local call rates with effect from the next month. II: The telephone bills of STD callers will be comparatively lower than before.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statements: I. The police authority has recently caught a group of house breakers. II. The citizen’s group in the locality has started a night vigil in the area.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Cause: It is found that the computer of one of the top officials in the Prime Minister's office is hacked. Which of the following can be a possible effect of the above cause?
options: The government may stop providing computers to top officials.
The government may order immediate change of security features on all computers used by top officials.
The government may ask all the top officials to take a backup of all the data in their computers immediately.
the government may ask all top officials to stop using computers for any government related work.
none of these.

quiz.text: Effect: A large number of people prefer gold ornaments to silver ornaments. Which of the following can be a possible cause for the above effect?
options: The price of silver ornaments has increased significantly.
Gold is a very costly metal.
The difference in the prices of silver and gold ornaments became very narrow and wearing gold ornaments has become a fashion now.
The price of gold ornaments decreases significantly.
none of these

quiz.text: Cause: The forest department has found several deadly tiger traps in the forests which fall under the Melghat tiger reserve. These traps are usually laid by African nomads. Which of the following can be a possible effect of the above cause?
options: The government may send army personnel to comb the place to find if there are more such traps.
Fencing may be constructed all around the reserve.
The government may take up the matter with the governments of African nations.
The local people and the officials may be alerted of movements of African nationals who look different by their wears and traits.
none of these

quiz.text: Effect: The government has decided to take up the irrigation projects on a war footing and complete all of them in the next two and half years. Which of the following can be a possible cause for the above effect?
options: Frequent floods are causing havoc in the life of those living in low-lying areas.
The ruling party may get good support from the agriculturists.
Scientists predicted very low rainfall for the next seven years.
The farmers in drought-prone areas can look forward to brighter days
none of these

quiz.text: Statement: I. There was a huge rush of people to the Passport Office last one week. II. The authorities had decided to close it down for a month and relocate elsewhere.
options: Statement (I) is the cause and statement (II) is the effect.
Statement (II) is the cause and statement (I) is the effect.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of independent causes.
Both the statements (I) and (II) are effects of some common cause.
